How do you determine the price of a home?
There are several ways to determine 
the price of a home. One way is to 
look at comparable homes in the 
area that have recently sold. This 
gives you an idea of what buyers are 
willing to pay for a home in that 
location. Another way is to use online 
home valuation tools, which can 
provide an estimate of the home's 
value based on publicly available 
data. A third way is to hire a real 
estate appraiser, who will physically 
inspect the home and provide a 
professional opinion of its value. 
Finally, you can also look at the 
home's features, such as its size, 
location, and condition, and use 
that information to determine a 
fair price.

Which of the following is NOT a 
way to determine the price of a 
home?

A) Looking at comparable homes 
that have recently sold
B) Using online home valuation 
tools
C) Hiring a real estate appraiser
D) Looking at the home's features

The correct answer is (D) Looking at the home's features. While considering a home's features is an important factor in determining its overall value, it is not a reliable way to determine the price of a home on its own. Features such as size, location, and condition can vary widely from one home to another, making it difficult to accurately determine a fair price without also considering other factors such as comparable sales, market trends, and professional appraisals.
